description: Cognate with coapt via co- and Latin aptō (“I fasten”); the coaptate version of the verb is probably a back-formation from coaptation.

verbs.description: coaptate (third-person singular simple present coaptates, present participle coaptating, simple past and past participle coaptated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, chiefly medicine) To join or attach.
examples: Female patients sometimes tell us that another woman enters her body and coaptates herself to it, especially during the act of coitus.
